column4: I had LVM installed in this server, but now I want install whole server from stratch. How I remove any existing LVM data? I don't need to save data.
manually partition and delete all the partitions, then start over.
install program still founds old LVM data and won't reinstall
using the alternate install disk?
No, server install CD
ok, I don't have experience with the server install, but it should work just fine.  I would manually partition everything, though.
you can always wipe the boot sector and partition table with DD, that should trash anything that's there.
I tried that...
errr: dd (lowercase)
I tried this: "dd if=/dev/zero of=/dev/sda bs=1k count=10"
the correct command is something like: dd if=/dev/zero of=/dev/hda bs=512 count=1
your command should have done it, though, it's just overkill
Nope, I have raid
I cut and pasted that line, change hda to whatever is appropriate.
which partition holds LVM information?
whatever partition you designate for LVM.  If you wipe the master partition it shouldn't matter.
I mean the primary partition table
the command you used should have worked, you need to do it as root (or sudo) and not have the drive mounted at the time, though (boot to live cd)
I just want to wipe LVM out and start over
yep, to be honest it should work to just select manual partitioning and wipe everything, then add the partitions the way you want during install.
dd should not even be necessary.
It is not that easy. Install process hangs if it founds about old LVM
Actually this is ubuntu+1 server, but I think it is the same for ubuntu
#ubuntu+1
